dublin_core.dcvalue: Introduction Despite improvements in surgical management sternal wound infection SWI following cardiac surgery remains a significant complication Aim To evaluate pathogens involved in SWI following median sternotomy Material and methods We enrolled 164 patients who experienced prolonged sternal wound healing following open heart surgery The inclusion criteria were as follows prolonged sternal wound healing following cardiac surgery via median sternotomy and complete results of microbiological culture obtained from the sternal swab The exclusion criteria were as follows partial sternotomy patients with mechanical sternum dehiscence and incomplete clinical data Swabs provided information on the type of microorganism present in the wound and the susceptibility of the microorganism to specific antibiotics Results One hundred and fourteen 69 5 patients aged 68 interquartile range 60 76 years developed SWI with positive culture The in hospital mortality rate was 21 0 in this group The most common pathogens included Staphylococcus epidermidis 26 6 Enterococcus faecium 12 2 Staphylococcus aureus 11 4 Klebsiella pneumoniae 8 4 and Pseudomonas aeruginosa 6 8 In most of the cases the isolated Staphylococcus epidermidis was methicillin resistant n 57 43 5 Enterococcus faecium was vancomycin resistant in 11 8 3 cases and high level aminoglycoside resistant HLAR in 13 9 9 cases Klebsiella pneumoniae had the extended spectrum lactamase ESBL mechanism in 14 10 6 cases Among 114 culture positive patients 48 42 1 had polymicrobial infection of the sternal wound Conclusions Microorganisms associated with SWI in our study were mainly commensals with the most common pathogen being Staphylococcus epidermidis Wst p Pomimo udoskonale w procedurach chirurgicznych nadal g wnym powik aniem po operacjach kardiochirurgicznych s zaka enia ran mostka Cel Ocena patogen w kt re wywo uj zaka enia ran mostka po sternotomii po rodkowej Materia i metody Do badania w czono 164 pacjent w u kt rych stwierdzono przed u one gojenie rany mostka po operacji kardiochirurgicznej Kryteria w czenia stanowi y przed u one gojenie si rany mostka po operacji kardiochirurgicznej z dost pu przez sternotomi po rodkow i kompletne wyniki hodowli mikrobiologicznej uzyskane z wymazu z mostka natomiast kryteria wy czenia cz ciowa sternotomia mechaniczne rozej cie si mostka i niekompletne dane kliniczne Mikroorganizmy by y identyfikowane za pomoc hodowli mikrobiologicznej na podstawie kt rej okre lano tak e ich lekowra liwo Wyniki U 114 69 5 pacjent w w wieku 68 lat rozst p mi dzykwartylowy 60 76 dosz o do zaka enia rany mostka miertelno w tej grupie wynosi a 21 Najcz ciej izolowane patogeny to Staphylococcus epidermidis 26 6 Enterococcus faecium 12 2 Staphylococcus aureus 11 4 Klebsiella pneumoniae 8 4 Pseudomonas aeruginosa 6 8 Wi kszo wyizolowanych szczep w Staphylococcus epidermidis by a metycylinooporna 57 43 5 Enterococcus faecium by oporny na glikopeptydy w 11 8 3 przypadkach oraz na du e st enia antybiotyk w aminoglikozydowych w 13 9 9 przypadkach Klebsiella pneumoniae wytwarza a laktamazy o rozszerzonym spektrum substratowym ESBL w 14 10 6 przypadkach Spo r d 114 pacjent w z dodatnim wynikiem posiewu w 48 42 1 przypadkach odnotowano infekcje wielopatogenowe Wnioski Mikroorganizmy powoduj ce wy ej wymienione zaka enia to g wnie komensale a najcz ciej wyst puj cym patogenem by Staphylococcus epidermidis
Kardiochirurgia i torakochirurgia polska = Polish journal of cardio-thoracic surgery
Sternal wound infections following cardiac surgery and their management: a single-centre study from the years 2016-2017.
